# INSearchForMediaIntentResponse

**Class**

An intents handler’s response to a search media intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INSearchForMediaIntentResponse
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntentResponse] object to specify the results after searching for the user-specified media. After performing the search action using the criteria specified in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntent] object, create an instance of this class with the results of the action. Siri communicates the status from your response to the user, at appropriate times.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your add media handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSearchForMediaIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Providing the Response Code

- **code**: A response code that indicates whether the app successfully searched for the media.
- **INSearchForMediaIntentResponseCode**: Codes returned by an intents handler in response to a search request.

## Accessing the Media Item

- **mediaItems**: The media items that were found by the search.

## Search for Media

- **INSearchForMediaIntentHandling**: The interface that handles media search requests.
- **INSearchForMediaIntent**: A request to search for a media item.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
